internal.content: --- title: "Configure LDAP" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 54 --- Companies use LDAP Servers to manage employee directory information across the enterprise. In this section you will connect to the existing LDAP Server and create a user with Administrative rights. ## üöÄ TASK: Create the LDAP Connection üåè Documentation for the Task: Configuring LDAP connection Connect to the existing LDAP Server using the following parameters: ```yaml Server type: Custom Base DN: dc=ibm,dc=com Bind DN: cn=admin,dc=ibm,dc=com Bind DN password: P4ssw0rd! LDAP server URL: ldap://openldap.openldap:389 ``` ```yaml Group filter: (&(cn=%v)(objectclass=groupOfUniqueNames)) User filter: (&(uid=%v)(objectclass=Person)) <-- Thats the only value you should have to change Group ID map: *:cn User ID map: *:uid Group member ID map: groupOfUniqueNames:uniqueMember ``` ## Create LDAP provider 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Administration` 1. Select `Access Control` ![image](./../images/20_config.png) 1. In the top right Click `Identity provider configuration` 1. You might have to re-login with your admin user 1. In the top right Click `New Connection` 1. Select `LDAP` from the dropdown 1. Click `Next` 1. Fill out the first section of fields: ```yaml Connection name: LDAP Server type: Custom Base DN: dc=ibm,dc=com Bind DN: cn=admin,dc=ibm,dc=com Bind DN password: P4ssw0rd! LDAP server URL: ldap://openldap.openldap:389 ``` ![image](./../images/21_config.png) 1. Click `Test connection`. You should get `Successful connection` 1. Fill out the rest of the fields: ```yaml Group filter: (&(cn=%v)(objectclass=groupOfUniqueNames)) User filter: (&(uid=%v)(objectclass=Person)) <-- Thats the only value you should have to change Group ID map: *:cn User ID map: *:uid Group member ID map: groupOfUniqueNames:uniqueMember ``` ![image](./../images/22_config.png) 1. Click `Create` 1. You should get a LDAP entry in the provider list ![image](./../images/23_config.png) ## üöÄ TASK: Create a User in CP4WAIOPS üåè Documentation for the Task: Adding users Create a user in CP4WAIOPS with Admin rights. ## Create User 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Administration` 1. Select `Access Control` ![image](./../images/20_config.png) 1. In the top right Click `Add users` 1. In the search box type `demo` 1. Click on the `demo/demo/demo@ibm.com` line 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Assign roles directly` 1. Click `Next` 1. Check `Administrator` role 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Add` ## Login as Demo 1. In `CP4WAIOPS`, click on the round image in the top right and select `Log Out` ![image](./../images/24_config.png) 1. Click `Logout` 1. Click `Log in` 1. Enter credentials `demo` and `P4ssw0rd!` (this information is stored in the LDAP server) 1. Welcome back in CP4WAIOPS as user Demo
